data.title: Definitely going to give this place another try
data.text:
This was our first time here, we saw the great reviews on another site & decided to give them a try. We were greeted by a friendly hostess & seated right away. Our waitress was personable & attentive.
I ordered the Peking Duck (one of my favorite dishes) & my dining companion ordered dim sum. The dim sum was made to order & very good (they have a larger selection on their weekend brunch menu). I was skeptical about ordering the Peking Duck because they said it comes pre-rolled (I prefer to prepare my own rolls). When it finally came to the table I think there were 6-8 rolls (I can't remember exactly its been a few days). I was extremely disappointed, there was very little of everything...duck, scallions & Hoisin sauce. I had asked the waitress if they could make the skin extra crispy when ordering & she said yes. No extra crispy skin & the duck was very fatty (my apologies if I am grossing anyone out), it was totally not worth 24.00. 
The couple next to us said they had been coming for years & have always found the food very good. Gauging by the quality of dim sum my companion had, we will most likely come back & try this place again, but I won't be ordering the Peking Duck again.

data.title: Very salty food
data.text: First time here at this restaurant and it has a pretty modern décor.  We had heard that it offered dim sum so that's we ordered.  The menu also offered sushi, which I found kind of odd since this is a Chinese restaurant.  We ordered the har gau, siu mai, XO turnip cake, bean curd rolls, beef balls, shrimp chive dumplings, and the Singapore noodles.  Before the dim sum came out, they offered us a choice of soup and we chose the hot and sour soup, which was pretty good and hot in flavor.  After that, things quickly went south.  The har gau and shrimp chive dumplings had too thick of a skin while the siu mai was something that you would buy from the local supermarket.  The XO turnip cake was very salty and mushy.  Same thing with the beef balls.  Looked more like squished balls and was salty as well.  The chef must love salt because everything except for the soup was oversalted.  We told the waitress about the saltiness and she offered to remake the dishes but the damage was done.

data.title: Good food
data.text: We visited Bistro Chen after an afternoon matinee at Metropolis Theater. Upon arrival at 545pm on a Sunday, the place was empty - which concerned me a little. However, people arrived as we were eating and from the flavor of the food, I should not have been worried. Since this is a restaurant is "natively" Chinese, I'd recommend sticking not straying into the sushi arena. I had a Mexican roll which was ok. But the Orange Tofu dish was really good - to the point where it's been a while that it's been that good. My son enjoyed the kids (massive) portion of Sweet and Sour Chicken. And my wife had the sushi/sashimi combo, which she said had fresh, large pieces of fish. We'd go back if we were in the neighborhood.

data.title: Best Dim Sum in the Suburbs!
data.text: We discovered Bistro Chen last Fall and have been coming back weekly ever since for Dim Sum.  The ingredients are fresh and the preparation and presentation is top notch.  The har gau (shrimp dumplings) are a must along with the pork and shrimp sui mai.  The crispy crab claw is the real deal - no fake crab in this one.  The eggplant with shrimp is simply delicious and the hot and sour soup is hands down the best we've had anywhere. Happy Hour prices are offered on beer and wine even on Sunday afternoon.  The staff is very helpful and attentive and the decor is charming.  You won't go wrong is visiting Bistro Chen!

data.title: Great Dim Sum
data.text:
Some friends and I tried real Dim Sum for the first time about 6 or 7 months ago, We just found Bistro Chen this past weekend, because the other place we used to go shut down. Dim Sum is very hard to find outside of the city, so we were sort of scratching our heads as to why we didn’t know about Bistro Chen…in any case, we went this past Saturday. The Dim Sum menu, as you would expect, is quite lengthy…it has a whole range of dumplings, all of which were excellent…we ordered the duck which is was very good, bbq pork buns…probably about a dozen dishes and they were all very good. They have some very authentic dishes as well (chicken feet for example) which goes a long way for me as far as determining potential of a dim sum place.

The staff were very attentive and friendly…at least three times they came out to us offering some dim sum plate that wasn’t on the menu, describing it for us etc…our water glasses and tea pot were likewise never empty. The didn’t have a dim sum cart that I saw, but that doesn’t bother me…they provided attentive and quick service, the food was very good, the prices very reasonable and it was a nice environment. We will be going there for Dim Sum for many years to come…not just because it is the only place near us, but because it is good!!!

Also - best Singapore Noodles I have ever had in my life!

data.title: Dim Sum!
data.text: So good - we had our post wedding family breakfast gathering there  in October - nice private room, - love their dim sum -we keep coming back - would give them a 5 but their service sometimes is slow - but the dim sum is always tasty.

data.title: Fresh sushi
data.text: Very pleasant surroundings - the booths were high-backed so the kid sitting next to us wasn't obtrusive (at least not to us).  The girl who served us was very attentive with a great smile.  Spicy tuna roll was fresh and very tasty.  I really liked this ginger salad dressing.  The steak and shrimp hibachi was very good, but we should have ordered something with more kick.  We'll do that next time we go.

data.title: Redesigned decor & refreshed menu!
data.text: We got the tip from a friend that this ages old Chinese restaurant was redone and modernized. My family goes here often. Oftentimes there are language barriers to order gluten free Chinese. But they get it! They are very helpful and one can order just about anything GF. They have a nice garden patio out back and the entire inside has been updated in design with a sushi bar addition too. Their package meal is very reasonable, quite filling and deelish. Service is great too.

data.title: Pleasant food and service
data.text: I had bought a coupon so we could try this place and we went here after a matinee show at the Metropolis theater.  We were seated immediately and given water shortly thereafter.  Their menu is very large so we ordered the calamari appetizer, which was in a tasty soy-based marinade, while we looked for an entree.  I ordered the crispy sesame beef while my wife had the almond duck.  We both chose the hot and sour soup as our starter - it wasn't as spicy as at other Chinese restaurants. The beef and duck main courses were good and contained more than enough food - we took leftovers home.  We finished with a mango pudding, which was very light with a subtle mango flavor.   Service was good - we had a very pleasant and friendly server (Kent).  We would return.

data.title: Great Chinese restaurant
data.text: Really nice restaurant right in downtown Arlington Heights.  Have eaten here many times with my family.  They have really good traditional Chinese food as well as sushi.  Can also accommodate gluten free diners with many options.  Nice little outdoor patio if the weather is nice.  Large carryout menu as well.

data.title: Good Chinese and more
data.text:
We enjoyed a good meal on Friday night. Not too busy. People are very nice and welcoming. Great big menu. Dim Sum was very good, BBQ pork bun was good, Crispy Crab Claw was excellent with tons of meat. Very good egg roll. My wife had the Cashew Chicken which she enjoyed a lot. I had the Volcano Chicken which had nice heat and lots of flavor. You could make a full meal from the Dim Sum selections - may give that a try next time. We will b back. Our server Linchong did a great job of informing us about the food and good choices.

Give it a try if you are in downtown Arlington Heights.

data.title: Sushi and chinese dishes are fantastic! And great for outdoor dining!
data.text: We went here for dinner and sat outside.  What a cute outdoor area.  We were greeted by a very nice server.  I had the saki-tini.  This was the best saki-tini I have ever had, it was so refreshing with the cucumber in it.  We were there before 6pm and there are drink specials-wine for $5 and beers on special too.  This restaurant is perfect for us since my husband doesn't like sushi but I crave it. They have something here for everyone.  My husband ordered the Prix Fixe menu.  It was a full dinner for $22.  It was plentiful and delicious! The crab Rangoon(I tasted this)was very good, crisp, not greasy and full or crab stuffing.  The salad with ginger dressing was huge.  And his portion of the sesame beef was also huge and extremely tasty(I also tasted it!). He also had the mango pudding.  Never had anything so good. You should try it, very good and refreshing. I had two sushi rolls-the Alligator and Hawaiian, both were very good and different.  The Hawaiian had the most delicious mango and white tuna salsa on top. Service was perfect, prices were not too high and the quality of the food was great!  I highly recommend this place!  We will be going back again and again.

data.title: Couldn't get over the bad smell when we walked it
data.text:
The smell of old seafood and something else spoiled was noticeable right when we entered.., should have turned around and left right then.  Ordered lunch specials that came with the slimiest egg drop soup I've ever tasted.., like I know it's supposed to have that viscosity.., but it was like snail snot.  The orange chicken tasted okay, but both my co-worker and I felt ill the rest of the afternoon.
Won't be going back..., ever.

data.title: Great dim sum
data.text: Came for Sunday lunch. Not too crowded and didn't have to wait unlike any place in Chinatown or even at the places in Schaumburg. That is a gold star right there! Food was good, not great but definitely better than half the places in Chinatown Chicago or even SF. Service was very friendly and helpful but even with maybe 3/4 of the tables occupied they were a little overwhelmed.  The dim sum a la carte detracts a little from a true dim sum experience with carts bringing out the food but that seems more popular these days everywhere. Definitely a good alternative to the Jockey and other dim sum places in the NW. Will definitely be back.

data.title: Best additions to AH restaurant landscape
data.text: Really enjoy this restaurant every time we eat there. Extensive selection of Dim Sum, amazing sashimi and fish Carpaccio. Chef's sushi and rolls are exquisite and the rest of the food is very good. Staff is extremely friendly and the whole atmosphere is very pleasant

data.title: Fresh Great Dim Sum in the Suburbs
data.text: My friend and I frequent the city often in search of great dim sum. As we live in the north suburbs we did not want to drive all the way downtown so came across this place in Arlington Heights. The staff was super friendly from beginning to end and the dim sum was very good as it was cooked to order. We did not try the sushi but saw many other diners doing so and will next time. We have definitely found our new place for dim sum!

data.title: Good try but nothing special
data.text:
This place advertises serving dim sum from scratch.  Since there is lack of good dim-sum places in suburb Chicago, I decide to give it a try.  We were there on a week day.  The place was not crowded and we ordered some common/familiar dim-sum items.  

Before the food arrived, the waiter gave us greasy plates.  Our table was in a well-lit spot and the uncleaned grease clearly reflected off all four plates.  I immediately complained and some better cleaned dishes came before the meal.  They must have just rinsed these dishes without really cleaning them.

Their pork sui mei was competent.  We also found their taro cake acceptable.  But the pork and shrimp in bean curd skin must be the toughest version I ever encountered in the US.  This is usually a dish after streaming will become soft and easy to cut and chew.  That was not the one I got on that day.  We also ordered a pan fried noodle dish, it has good flavor although a little too salty for my taste.

Overall this place tries to elevate the dim sum dishes in the Chicago suburb but I am not sure what kind of target audience they have in mind.  In general some of their dim sum dishes are acceptable and better than most found in the AH area. The dish quantity is about 33% or one-third less than what you can get from the Chinatown.  You need to keep that in mind if traveling to Chinatown is inconvenient for your party.  So this restaurant cannot win on food quantity and it also cannot win on food quality.  About the atmosphere and decor, it is nothing special and the owner definitely does not place emphasis on the American folks as PF Chang does.  I can see the thin-line cracks on my table while waiting for the check.  This could be just my table is somewhat old and the rest is just fine.  However, everything I see is marginal.  So unless you are hungry for some dim-sum dishes and really cannot drive an hour to Chinatown, you most likely will not become a frequent diner in this restaurant.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: This is some of the freshest and highest quality Chinese food in the area.  The only problem, it's a little pricey.  Generally, I don't mind paying extra since you get much better quality food.

data.title: Fresh, delicious sushi and friendly service
data.text: Sushi was awesome and fresh.  Service was a little scattered but friendly and we weren't in  a rush so it was well paced.

data.title: Veggie Dim Sum
data.text:
Veggie Dim Sum!  Yes, sometimes even when going to China Town, I have a really hard time getting veggie dim sum that doesn't have fish sauce with it..  You won't have that issue here.

When we are out in the suburbs to visit family, we actually make a detour out of the way just to come here for Dim Sum brunch. We've sat both inside and outside (the outside is lovely, although you are definitely in an alley of sorts).

I usually order just about every veggie dim sum on the menu. My favorites and recommended are the Veggie Crepes (weekends only), Veggie Tofu Wrap, Steamed Greens, I also enjoy the apple and seaweed salad. They have favor flavorful sauces to pair with the dishes.

The Chinese entrees look fantastic, we'll have to stop in to try in the evening.

Lastly, every so often they get fish fresh from Japan. Recently my husband had a huge scallop and a clam. Amazing presentation, and the scallop was sushi grade perfection.
